verses.text: This is the message of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, who wrote this. He was a priest, from the town of Anathoth in the area where the tribe of Benjamin lives.
Yahweh started to give him these messages when Josiah had been ruling Judah for almost thirteen years.

Yahweh continued to give him messages when Josiah's son Jehoiakim was the king, and he continued to do that until Zedekiah had been the king of Judah for almost eleven years. It was in the fifth month of that year that the people of Jerusalem were exiled to Babylonia.
\m

One day Yahweh gave me this message,
\q1

"I knew you before I finished forming you in your mother's womb.
\q2 I set you apart for my honor before you were born,
\q2 and I appointed you to be my prophet for all the nations."

I replied, "O, Yahweh my God, do you not see that I am not qualified to speak for you? I am very young!"
\m
Yahweh replied, "Do not say that you are too young, because you must go to everyone to whom I will send you, and you must tell them everything that I tell you to say.

And you must not be afraid of the people to whom you will speak, because I will protect you from being harmed by them. This will surely happen because I, Yahweh, have said it!"
\m
\m
Then it was as though Yahweh touched my mouth and said, "Listen to me! I have put my message into your mouth.

Today I am appointing you to warn nations and kingdoms. You will tell them that I will completely destroy and get rid of some of them and that I will establish others and cause them to be prosperous."
\m

Then Yahweh showed something to me, and said, "Jeremiah, what do you see?"
 I replied, "I see a branch from an almond tree."

Yahweh said, "That is correct. And because the word for 'almond' resembles the word for 'watching', it means that I am watching what will happen, and I will make certain that what I have said to you about destroying nations will happen."
\m

Then Yahweh spoke to me again and said, "What do you see now?"
 I replied, "I see a pot full of boiling water. It is in the north, tipping toward me."

Yahweh replied, "Yes! It means that from the north great trouble will spread over this land, like boiling water pouring from a pot.
\q1

Listen to what I say:
\q2 I am summoning the armies of the kingdoms that are north of Judah to come to Jerusalem. \q1 Their kings will set up their thrones at the gates of this city to indicate that they are now the kings of Judah.
\q2 Their armies will attack and break down the walls of this city, and they will do the same thing to all the other towns in Judah.
\q1

So, get up and put on your clothes to get ready for action! Then go to the people of Judah and tell them everything that I tell you to say. Do not be afraid of them, because if you are afraid of them, I will punish you as an example right in front of them!

But listen! I will cause you to be strong, like a city that has strong walls around it. You will be as strong as an iron pillar or a bronze wall. Neither the royal officials or priests nor the general populace will be able to defeat you.
They will oppose you, but they will not be able to defeat you, because I will be with you and will protect you. That will surely happen because I, Yahweh, have said it!"
Yahweh gave me another message

to proclaim to everyone in Jerusalem. He said that I should tell them this, 
\q1 "I, Yahweh, remember in your favor that you followed me and trusted in our covenant long ago.
\q2 You tried to please me like a bride tries to please her husband;
\q1 You loved me,
\q2 and you followed me through the desert.
\q1

At that time you Israelites were set apart to me;
\q2 you belonged to me like the first part of the harvests belong to me.
\q1 I promised to punish all those who harmed you, my people,
\q2 and send disasters on them.
\q2 This is the way it will always be since I, Yahweh, said that it would happen."
\q1
Listen to what Yahweh says, descendants of Jacob, all you people of Israel. You must listen to what Yahweh says.

He says,
\q2 "What sin did I commit that caused your ancestors to turn far away from me?
\q1 They worshiped worthless idols,
\q2 and they themselves became worthless.
\q1

They had no need to say, 'Yahweh is no longer able to help us, even though it was he who brought us safely out of Egypt
\q1 and led us through a desert plain
\q2 where there were a lot of pits.
\q1 It was Yahweh who led us where there was no water and where it was very dangerous,
\q2 through a land where no one lives or even travels.
\q1 But Yahweh is useless for us now.'
\q1

But when I, Yahweh, brought you into a very fertile land,
\q2 in order that you could enjoy all the fruit and other good things that you would harvest,
\q1 you caused the land that I promised to give to you to be unfit for me
\q2 and to become disgusting to me.
\q1

Your priests also did not ask
\q2 if I was still with them.
\q1 Those who teach God's laws are not faithful to me themselves!
\q2 And your leaders have rebelled against me.
\q1 Your prophets gave you messages from their god Baal,
\q2 and they worship worthless idols.
\q1

So I, Yahweh, will accuse you in court.
\q1 In future years, I will also bring your children and your grandchildren to trial!
\q1 That will happen because I, Yahweh, have said that it will happen.
\b
\q1

If you go west to the island of Cyprus,
\q2 or if you go east to Kedar land,
\q1 and if you ask people in those places,
\q2 they will tell you that no people from their countries have ever done the wicked things that you people have done!
\q1

No people of any nation have ever abandoned their gods that they thought were glorious
\q2 and started to worship gods that are not really gods,
\q1 but you people have abandoned me, your glorious God,
\q2 and are worshiping gods that are useless.
\q1

You, my people, have done two evil things:
\q1 you have rejected me, the one who is like a fountain where you can obtain fresh water,
\q2 and you are worshiping gods that are like pits in the ground
\q2 that are cracked and which are not able to hold any water.
\b
\q1

Your enemies roared like lions,
\q2 and they destroyed your land.
\q1 Now your towns have been burned,
\q2 and no one lives in them.
\q1

Soldiers from Memphis and Tahpenes, cities in Egypt, have defeated you
\q2 and shaved your heads to show that you are their slaves.
\q1

But it is because you abandoned me, Yahweh your God,
\q2 that these disasters have happened to you, since I had been leading your to safety.
\q1

So why are you trying to make an alliance with the rulers of Egypt who live near the Shihor?
\q2 Why are you trying to make an alliance with the rulers of Assyria who live near the Euphrates River?
\q1

It is because you have been very wicked that I will punish you.
\q2 It is because you have turned away from me that I will condemn you.
\q1 When I do that, you will realize that bitter and evil things will happen to you because you have forsaken me, Yahweh, your God,
\q2 and you no longer have an awesome respect for me.
\q1 That will certainly happen because I, the Lord, Yahweh, commander of the angel armies in heaven, have said it.
\b
\q1

Long ago, you stopped obeying me and you would not allow me to lead you.
\q2 You refused to worship me, even though I saved you from being slaves.
\q1 Instead, you worship idols that are under trees on the top of every hill.
\q2 You love and worship those idols instead of me just like an unfaithful man loves a prostitute instead of his wife.
\q1

It is as though you were a grapevine that I planted
\q2 when it was a cutting from a very good vine. 
\q1 So now it is disgusting that you have become like a rotten worthless vine.
\q1

Your guilt from your sins is like very bad stains on a cloth,
\q2 and you cannot get rid of those stains even by using very strong soap.
\q1 This is true because I, Yahweh, have said it.
\q1

You say that you have not sinned.
\q1 You claim to be acceptable to God
\q2 and that you have not worshiped the images of Baal.
\q1 But think about the disgusting things that you do very eagerly in Hinnom Valley outside Jerusalem.
\q2 You are like desperate female camels, running here and there to find male camels to sleep with.
\q1

You are like wild female donkeys in the desert.
\q2 They sniff the air to find where the male donkeys are,
\q2 and no one can restrain them.
\q1 The male donkeys that want them do not tire themselves out searching for them,
\q2 because at mating time they find them easily.
\q1

You constantly run here and there to find idols to worship, with the result that your sandals are worn out,
\q2 and your throats have become dry.
\q1 I told you to stop doing that but you said that you could not stop,
\q2 and you said that you loved those foreign gods
\q2 and had to worship them!
\b
\q1

A robber is disgraced when he is caught.
\q2 And all of you, including your kings and priests and prophets, are similarly disgraced.
\q1

You call a piece of wood that is carved to become a sacred idol, your 'father,'
\q2 and you call a stone that you have set up, your 'mother.'
\q1 You have rejected me
\q2 but when you experience troubles,
\q1 you call for me to rescue you!
\q1

Why do you not shout to the gods that you made?
\q2 Why do you not plead with them to rescue you
\q2 when you experience disasters?
\q1 For you have as many gods as you have cities and towns in Judah!
\b
\q1

You complain that it was wrong for me not to have rescued you,
\q2 but you have all rebelled against me, Yahweh, the one who is speaking to you right now.
\q1

I punished some of you,
\q2 but you did not learn anything from my doing that.
\q1 Instead you have killed many of the prophets that I sent to you,
\q2 like fierce lions kill other animals.
\b

You people of Israel, pay attention to what I say.
\q1 I have certainly never abandoned you in a desert;
\q2 I have never left you in a very dark land.
\q1 So, why do you, my people, say that you are free from my control
\q2 and that you will not return to worship me anymore?
\q1

A young woman would certainly never forget to wear her jewelry,
\q2 and a bride would never forget to wear her wedding dress,
\q1 but you my people have forgotten me for many years.
\q1

You know how to easily find gods from other countries whom you can love.
\q2 You can find them more easily than a prostitute can find men to sleep with. You could teach her about infidelity!
\q1

Although you have on your clothes the blood of poor people whom you have murdered,
\q2 people who were innocent! You did not catch them robbing you, but you chose to treat her wickedly.
\q1

Yet you say, 'I have done nothing wrong!
\q2 I am sure that Yahweh will not be angry with me for much longer.'
\q1 But I will punish you severely
\q2 for claiming that you have not sinned.
\b
\q1

Previously you requested the army of Assyria to help you,
\q2 but they were not able to help you.
\q1 Now you have requested the army of Egypt to help you,
\q2 but they will not be able to help you, either.
\q1

They will capture you, and you will be their prisoners,
\q2 led to Egypt, very ashamed with your hands on your heads.
\q1 That will happen because Yahweh has rejected those nations that you are relying on,
\q2 and they will not be able to help you at all."

"People know that if a man divorces his wife and then she marries another man,
\q2 her first husband certainly must not take her back again to be his wife again.
\q1 She would be ceremonially unclean and she has broken the law of Yahweh. 
\q1 This nation is like this woman. 
\q1 But you have more idols than prostitutes have men whom they have slept with!
\q2 So, why should I accept you if you return to me? it is Yahweh who says this. 
\q1

"Look up at the barren hilltops.
\q2 On every hilltop you have given yourselves to the idols 
\q2 in the way a prostitute gives herself to her lovers.
\q1 You sat along the roadsides like an Arab nomad who is always waiting in the desert for someone to come; 
\q2 but you are waiting to have sex with those who pass by.
\q1 Your unfaithfulness is the worship of idols,  
\q2 and your prostitution is just like your idol worship.
\q1 The whole land is made unacceptable to Yahweh, 
\q2 and your worship of idols is your prostitution and your wickedness is what made you unclean. 
\q1

That is why I have not sent you any rain at the times of the year when you needed it.
\q1 But you are like prostitutes
\q2 who are not at all ashamed for what they have done.
\q1

Now each of you says to me, 'You are my father!
\q2 You have loved me ever since I was young!
\q1

So surely you will not be angry with me forever!'
\q1 You promised you would not obey me, and you did what you said! 
\q2 And you sinned over and over again! 
\q1 But you will not quit sinning!"

One day when Josiah was the king of Judah, Yahweh said to me, "Have you seen what the people of Israel have done? They have turned away from me, like a woman who has abandoned her husband and sleeps with other men. They have gone up on every hilltop and under every big tree and worshiped idols there.
I thought that they would return to me, so I said to them, 'Come back to me!' But they refused. The people of Judah were watching all of this.

So I sent the people of Israel away to other countries, like a man writes a note saying that he is divorcing his wife and then sends his wife away because she has committed adultery. The people of Judah saw what I did to them, but they are just like the people of Israel. They are not afraid of what I will do to them. They also have turned away from me and are worshiping idols like women who abandon their husbands and go to other men.
They did not care that worshiping idols offended me, so they have made the entire land unacceptable to me by worshiping idols of wood and stone.
The people of Judah have pretended to return to me, but they have not really done that. This is true because I, Yahweh, have said it."
Then Yahweh said to me, "Jeremiah, the people of Israel have turned away from me, but what the people of Judah have done is worse.

So go and tell this to the people of Israel,
\q1 'Yahweh says this to you Israelite people who have turned away from him:
\q1 I am merciful.
\q2 I will not continue to be angry with you forever.
\q2 So return to me.
\q1

But you must admit that you are guilty,
\q2 and that you have rebelled against me, Yahweh, your God,
\q1 that you have worshiped idols under big trees everywhere,
\q2 and you have not obeyed me.
 You have turned away from me.
\q1

But you belong to me,
\q2 so come back to me, my children!
\q2 If you do, I will take you, one from each city and two from each clan,
\q2 and bring you back to Jerusalem.
\q1

If you do that, I will appoint for you leaders with whom I am pleased
\q2 who will guide you well because they will know and understand what pleases me.
\q1

And when you become very numerous in your land,
\q2 you will not need to talk about the Sacred Chest that contained the Ten Commandments.
\q1 You will not think about it,
\q2 and you will not want to make a new one.'
\q1

At that time people will say that my throne is in Jerusalem.
\q1 People from all nations will come there to worship me,
\q2 and they will no longer stubbornly do the evil things that they desire in their inner beings.
\q1

At that time you people of Israel and Judah will return from being exiled in lands to the north.
\q2 You will return to the land that I gave to your ancestors to belong to them forever.

You people of Israel, I wanted to accept you to be my children.
\q1 I wanted to give you this delightful land.
\q2 It is a land more desirable than the land of any other nation!
\q1 I wanted you to call me your father,
\q2 and I wanted you to never turn away from me.
\q1

But you have abandoned me like wives who have abandoned their husbands."
\q2 That is what Yahweh said, and I told it to the people of Israel.
\q1

Then God said, "People will hear a noise on the barren hilltops.
\q2 It will be the noise made by people weeping and pleading for God to be merciful to them.
\q1 They will be admitting that they have forgotten Yahweh their God,
\q2 and that they turned away from behaving as God wanted them to.
\b
\q1

You Israelite people, come back to me!
\q2 If you do that, I will cause you to never turn away from me again."
\b
\q1 The people will reply, "We are returning to you,
\q2 because you are Yahweh, our God.
\q1

We did not get any help from the idols that we worshiped on the hilltops,
\q2 we did not get any help from making all that noise up there. We now recognize that Yahweh our God is the only way Israel will be saved!
\q1

From the time when we were young, the shameful god Baal has taken away from us everything that our ancestors worked hard to acquire.
\q2 He has taken away their flocks of sheep and herds of cattle, their sons and their daughters.
\q1

So, now we should lie down feeling very ashamed,
\q2 because we and our ancestors have sinned against Yahweh our God,
\q1 and we have never obeyed him."

Yahweh says, "You Israelite people, if you come back to anyone, it should be to me.
\q2 If you get rid of those detestable idols,
\q2 if you do not go away from me again,
\q1

and if you declare, 'Just as surely as Yahweh lives, what he says is true and just,
\q1 and he teaches righteous living,'
\q2 then the people in the other nations of the world will ask me to bless them as I have blessed you,
\q1 and they will all come and honor me."
\b

This is what Yahweh says to the people of Jerusalem and the other cities in Judah,
\q1 "Cause your inner beings to be ready to receive my messages
\q2 like farmers plow up hard ground in order that they can plant seed in it.
\q1 Just as farmers do not waste good seed by sowing seeds among thorny plants,
\q2 I do not want to waste my time telling you messages that you are not ready to receive.
\q1

Show that your inner beings and your minds are devoted to me.
\q2 If you do not do that, my being angry with you
\q2 because of all the sins that you have committed
\q2 will be like a fire that will be impossible to extinguish.
\q1

Declare this to all the people in Jerusalem and the rest of Judea;
\q2 blow the trumpets everywhere in the land to warn the people.
\q1 Tell them that they should flee to
\q2 the cities that have high walls around them.
\q1

Shout to the people of Jerusalem
\q1 and run away now. Do not delay,
\q2 because I am about to bring a terrible disaster upon you
\q2 that will come from the north.
\q1

An army that has destroyed many nations will attack you
\q2 like a lion that comes out of its den to attack other animals.
\q1 The soldiers of that army
\q2 are already marching toward your land.
\q2 They will destroy your cities and leave them without any people still living in them.

So, put on rough clothes
\q1 and weep and beat your breasts
\q2 to show that you are very sorry for what you have done,
\q2 because Yahweh is still very angry with us.
\b
\q1

Yahweh declares that at the time when Yahweh punishes you, the king of Judah and all his officials will be very afraid.
\q2 The priests and the prophets will be terrified."

Then I replied, "Yahweh my God, you completely deceived the people by telling them that there would be peace in Jerusalem, but now our enemies are ready to slaughter us with their swords!"
\b

Yahweh told me that when that happens, some will say to the people of Jerusalem,
\q1 "A huge army will come to attack you.
\q2 They will not be like a gentle breeze that separates the wheat from the chaff.
\q1 They will be like a very hot wind that blows in from the desert.
\q1

They will be like a strong blast that I will send.
\q2 Now I am declaring that I will punish you."
\b
\q1

And the people in Jerusalem will say, "Our enemies are about to rush down on us; their chariots are like whirlwinds.
\q2 Their horses are faster than eagles.
\q1 It will be terrible for us!
\q1

You people of Jerusalem cleanse your inner beings,
\q2 in order that Yahweh will rescue you.
\q1 How long will you continue to think about doing evil deeds?
\q1

From the city of Dan in the far north to the hills of Ephraim a few miles north of Jerusalem messengers are proclaiming that disasters are coming."
\q1

So I said this to the people in other nations,
\q2 and also announced it in Jerusalem,
\q1 "Yahweh says that an army is coming to Jerusalem from far away;
\q2 they will shout a battle cry against the cities of Judah.
\q1

They will set up tents around Jerusalem like people set up temporary shelters around a field at harvest time.
\q2 That will happen because the people of Judah have rebelled against me.
\q1

You will be punished very severely;
\q2 it will be as though a sword has stabbed your hearts.
\q1 But you are causing those things to happen to you
\q2 because of the evil things that you have done."
\b
\q1

Then I said to myself, "I am extremely anguished;
\q2 the pain in my inner being is very severe.
\q2 My heart beats wildly!
\q1 But I cannot remain silent
\q2 because I have heard our enemies blowing their trumpets
\q2 to announce that the battle against Judah will start immediately!
\q1

Disasters will occur one after another
\q2 until the whole land is ruined.
\q1 Suddenly all our tents will be destroyed;
\q2 even the curtains inside the tents will be ripped apart.
\q1

How long will this battle continue?
\q2 How long will I continue to see the enemy battle flags
\q2 and hear the sound of their trumpets being blown?
\b
\q1

Yahweh says: My people are very foolish!
\q2 They do not have a relationship with me.
\q1 They are like stupid children
\q2 who do not understand anything.
\q1 They very cleverly do what is wrong,
\q2 but they do not know how to do what is good.
\b
\q1

God gave me a vision in which I saw
\q2 that the earth was barren and without form.
\q1 I looked at the sky,
\q2 and there was no light there.
\q1

I looked at the mountains and hills,
\q2 and they shook and moved from side to side.
\q1

I looked and saw that all there were no more people
\q2 and all the birds had flown away.
\q1

This is what Yahweh is saying,
\q1 "the entire land of Judah will be ruined,
\q2 but I will not destroy it completely.
\q1

I will do to my people what I said that I would do,
\q2 and I will not change my mind.
\q1 So when that happens, it will be as though the earth will mourn
\q2 and the sky will become very dark.
\b
\q1

When the people hear the sound of the enemy cavalry and archers marching,
\q2 they will be terrified as they flee from their cities.
\q1 Some of them will find places to hide in the bushes,
\q2 and others will run toward the quarries to escape being killed by their enemies.
\q1 All the cities in Judah will be abandoned;
\q2 not one person will remain in them.
\b
\q1

So you who will surely be destroyed,
\q2 what will you do then?
\q2 Even though you have worn beautiful clothes and jewelry
\q2 and paint around your eyes,
\q1 those things will not help you,
\q2 because the people in other countries that you think love you really despise you,
\q2 and they will try to kill you.
\b
\q1

It is as though I already hear the people in Jerusalem crying very loudly,
\q2 as a woman cries when she is giving birth to her first child;
\q1 she gasps for breath and pleads for someone to help her,
\q2 and she shouts, 'Something terrible is happening to me; they are about to murder me!'"

Yahweh said to the people of Jerusalem, "Go up and down every street.
\q2 Search in the marketplaces to find people who do what is fair,
\q2 who try to be faithful to me.
\q1 If you find even one person like that,
\q2 I will forgive the people of Jerusalem and not destroy their city.
\q1

But when the people there swear an official oath by Yahweh's life,
\q1 they are lying."
\b
\q1

So I prayed, "Yahweh, you are certainly searching for people who are faithful to you.
\q2 You punished your people, but they did not pay any attention.
\q1 You crushed them, but they ignored what you were telling them to do.
\q1 They were extremely stubborn
\q2 and refused to return to you."
\q1

So, I will go and talk to their leaders,
\q2 because they surely know how God wants them to conduct their lives."
\q1 But they also have stopped obeying Yahweh,
\q2 and they will not allow him to lead them.
\q1

Because of that, lions will come out of the forests and kill them;
\q2 wolves from the desert will attack them;
\q2 leopards that lurk outside their cities will maul anyone who walks outside the cities.
\q1 Those things will happen because the people have sinned very much against God
\q2 and have turned away from him very frequently.
\b
\q1

Yahweh says, "I cannot forgive these people;
\q2 even their children have abandoned me.
\q1 When they solemnly declare something, they ask their gods to show that what they say is true.
\q1 I gave my people everything that they needed,
\q2 but they often went to the high places on the hills, where they worshiped their idols and committed adultery there.
\q1

Just like well fed male horses neigh, wanting to mate with female horses,
\q2 each of the men desires to sleep with his neighbor's wife.
\q1

Should I not punish them for this?
\q2 I will certainly get revenge on this nation whose people behave like that!
\b
\q1

The people of Judah and Israel are like a vineyard.
\q1 Go along the rows in their vineyards
\q1 and get rid of most of the people,
\q2 but do not kill all of them.
\q1 These people do not belong to me,
\q1 so get rid of them,
\q2 like a gardener lops off branches from a vine.
\q1

The people of Israel and Judah have turned away from me completely.
\q1

They have lied about me and said,
\q2 'He is not even real!
\q2 He will not punish us!
\q2 He will not send disasters on us!
\q2 We will not experience wars or famines!
\q1

What God's prophets say is nothing but wind!
\q2 They do not have messages from God!
\q2 And because they have not believed me, all of these things will happen to them!'"
\b

So, this is what Yahweh, the commander of the armies of angels in heaven, has said to me,
\q1 "Because my people are saying those things,
\q2 I will give you a message to tell them that will be like a fire,
\q2 and these people will be like wood that the fire will burn up completely!
\q1

Listen to Yahweh's declaration, you people of Israel:
\q1 I will bring the army of a distant nation to attack you.
\q2 It is a very powerful nation that has existed for a long time.
\q1 They speak a language that you do not know,
\q2 and which you will not be able to understand.
\q1

Their soldiers are all very strong,
\q2 and the arrows from their quivers will send many Judean men to their graves.
\q1

They will eat the food that you have harvested from your fields,
\q2 even though it should be your own children who eat your bread.
\q1 They will kill your flocks of sheep and herds of cattle.
\q2 They will eat your grapes and your figs.
\q1 They will also destroy your cities that have high walls around them
\q2 and kill the people with their swords.

But even when those things happen, I will not get rid of all of you.
\q1

And when the people ask, 'Why is Yahweh doing this to us?'
\q2 you will tell them, 'You rejected him and worshiped foreign gods in your own land,
\q2 so now you will become slaves of foreigners in a land that is not your land.'"
\b
\q1

Yahweh instructed me to proclaim this message to the people of Israel and Judah,
\q1

"Listen to this, you people who are foolish and who do not have any sense:
\q2 You have eyes, but it is as though you cannot see;

I also told them that if they obeyed me, they would be my people and I would be their God.

Now tell these people that if they obey me, I will do what I promised to do for their ancestors. I will enable them to continue living in this very fertile land in which they now live."
 I replied, "Yahweh, I trust you that what you have said will happen."

Then Yahweh said to me, "Go into the streets of Jerusalem and to the other cities in Judah. Proclaim my message to the people. Tell them to listen to the agreement that I made with their ancestors and to obey it.
When I brought their ancestors out of Egypt, I solemnly pleaded with them many times to obey me, and I am still pleading with them now.

But they did not obey me or even pay any attention to me. Everyone continued to be stubborn and to do the evil things that they wanted to do. I commanded them to do what was written in the agreement, but they refused. So I punished them in all the ways that I promised that I would."
Then Yahweh said to me, "The people of Jerusalem and the other cities in Judah are rebelling against me.

Their ancestors refused to do what I told them to do, and now these people have returned to committing the sins that their ancestors committed. They are worshiping other gods. The people of Israel disobeyed the agreement that I made with their ancestors, and now the people of Judah have done the same thing.
So now I, Yahweh, am warning them that I will cause disasters to come to them, and they will not escape. And when they call out for me to help them, I will not pay attention.

When that happens, the people in Jerusalem and other cities in Judah will offer sacrifices and burn incense to their gods and ask for their help, but those gods will not be able to save them when those disasters come to them.
There are now as many gods in Judah as there are towns in Judah; the people of Jerusalem have erected as many altars to burn incense to those gods as there are streets in Jerusalem.

Jeremiah, do not pray for these people, and do not plead with me to rescue them. If you plead with me, I will not pay attention; and if they call out to me for help when they are in distress, I will not listen to them."

Then Yahweh said,
\q1 "The people of Judah whom I love certainly no longer have a right to come to my temple,
\q2 because they continually do many evil things.
\q1 They think that continually making sacrifices of meat to me certainly will protect them from disasters,
\q2 with the result that they will be able to rejoice.
\q1

I previously said that they were like an olive tree full of green leaves
\q2 with a lot of good olives on it,
\q1 but now I will send their enemies to attack them furiously;
\q2 it is as though I will break off their branches, and their city will be destroyed by fire.

It is as though the people of Judah and Israel were a beautiful olive tree that I, Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, planted,
\q2 but now, by burning incense to their god Baal, they have caused me to become very angry.
\q1 So now I have decided to destroy them."
Yahweh revealed to me that my enemies were planning to kill me.

Before he did that, I was like a lamb that was being led away to be slaughtered; I did not know what they were planning to do. I did not know that they were saying, "Let us get rid of this tree and its fruit," so I did not know that they intended to kill me, in order that no one would remember me.
\q1

Then I prayed, "Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, you judge people justly,
\q2 and you examine everything that we are thinking.
\q1 Allow me to watch you getting revenge on the people who want to kill me,
\q2 because I trust that you will do for me what is right."
\b
It was the men of my own town, Anathoth, who wanted to kill me, and they told me that they would kill me if I did not stop prophesying what Yahweh told me to say.
So Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, said about them, "I will punish them. Their young men will be killed in wars, and their children will die because they have no food.
I have set a time when I will bring disasters to the people of Anathoth, and when that happens, none of them will remain alive."

Yahweh, whenever I tell you that I am unhappy about what is happening to me,
\q2 you always act justly.
\q1 So now allow me to ask about one more thing that I do not understand:
\q2 Why are wicked people often very prosperous?
\q2 Why do things go very well for dishonest people?
\q1

You allow them to prosper
\q2 like trees that grow tall and bear a lot of fruit.
\q1 They always say good things about you,
\q2 but in their inner beings, they are really far from you.
\q1

But Yahweh, as for me, you know what is in my inner being.
\q2 You see what I do and you are able to know what I am thinking.
\q1 So drag away those wicked people,
\q2 like people drag away sheep that they are going to butcher.
\q1 Set them aside like sheep that are about to be slaughtered!
\q1

This land is becoming very dry and even the grass is withering.
\q1 The wild animals and the birds have all died
\q2 because the people are very wicked.
\q1 All this has happened because the people have said,
\q2 "Yahweh does not know what we are doing!"

Then to show me that I needed to be prepared to endure even greater difficulties, Yahweh said to me,
\q1 "It is as though you have become exhausted from racing against men;
\q2 so how will you be able to race against horses?
\q1 If you only prepare to run on open ground,
\q2 what will happen to you when you are running through the thick foliage near the Jordan River?
\q1

Already your brothers and other members of your own family oppose you.
\q2 They plot against you and they say bad things about you.
\q2 So even if they say nice things about you,
\q1 do not trust them!
\b
\q1

I have abandoned my Israelite people,
\q2 the people whom I chose to belong to me.
\q1 I have allowed their enemies to conquer the people whom I love.
\q1

My people have become to me like a lion in the forest.
\q2 It is as though they roar at me like a lion,
\q2 so now I hate them.
\q1

My chosen people have become like speckled hawks
\q2 that are surrounded by vultures waiting to eat their flesh after they are dead.
\q1 Tell all the wild animals to come
\q2 and eat the flesh of their corpses.
\q1

Many rulers from other countries have come with their armies and devastated my people
\q2 whom I care for like a farmer takes care of his vineyard.
\q1 They have caused my beautiful land to become a barren desert where no one lives.
\q1

They have caused it to become completely empty;
\q2 So now it is as though I am mourning the death of a loved one.
\q1 The whole land is desolate,
\q2 and no one worries about it.
\q1

The soldiers of our enemies have marched across all the barren hilltops.
\q1 But I, Yahweh, am using those armies to punish your land from one end to the other,
\q2 and no one will escape.
\q1

It is as though my people planted wheat,
\q2 but now they are harvesting thorns.
\q1 They have become very tired because of much hard work,
\q2 but they have gained nothing from all that work.
\q1 They will be very disappointed because their harvests will be very small,
\q2 and that will happen because I, Yahweh, am extremely angry with them."
\b

This is also what Yahweh said to me: "I will punish the evil nearby nations that have been trying to take away the land that I gave to my Israelite people. I will force them to leave their own lands. But I will throw the people of Judah out of their lands, also.
But later I will act mercifully toward those nations again, and I will bring them back to their own lands again. Each clan will come back to its own land.

And if the people of the other nations whose armies have invaded Israel learn the religious customs of my people, and if they learn that I am listening when they solemnly promise that they will do something, like they taught my people to believe that their god Baal was listening when they made solemn promises, I will cause them to become prosperous, and they also will be my people.
But I will expel any nation whose people refuse to obey me, and I will destroy that nation and its people. That will surely happen because I, Yahweh, have said it."
One day Yahweh said to me, "Go and buy a linen waistcloth. Put it on, but do not wash it."
So I bought a very nice waistcloth, which is what Yahweh told me to do, and I put it on.
Then later Yahweh gave me another message.
He said, "Go to the Euphrates River and hide your waistcloth in a crevice in the rocks."
So I went to the river and did what Yahweh told me to do.
A long time later, Yahweh said to me, "Go back to the river and get the waistcloth that I told you to hide there."
So I went to the Euphrates River and dug out the waistcloth from the crevice in which I had hidden it. But it was ruined, and useless.
Then Yahweh gave me this message:
"What happened to your waistcloth shows that I will destroy the things that the people of Jerusalem and other places in Judah are very proud of.

Those wicked people refuse to pay attention to what I say. They stubbornly do just what they desire to do; they worship other gods. Therefore, they will become completely useless, like your waistcloth.

Just like a waistcloth clings closely to a man's waist, I wanted the people of Israel and Judah to cling closely to me. I wanted them to be my people, people who would praise me and honor me. But they would not pay attention to me.

So, tell this to them: 'Yahweh, the God whom you Israelite people worship, says that every leather wineskin should be filled with wine.' And when you tell that to them, they will reply, 'Of course we know that all wineskins should be filled with wine!'

And then you must tell them, 'No, that is not what Yahweh means. What he said means that he will cause this land to be filled with people who are drunk. That will include all of you—the king who sits on the throne that King David previously sat on, the priests and the prophets, and even the common people of Jerusalem.'

He is saying, 'I will cause a drunken brawl among you. Even parents will brawl with their children. I will not pity you or act mercifully toward you at all; pitying you will not prevent me from getting rid of you.'"
\q1

You people of Judah, pay very careful attention.
\q2 Do not be proud, because Yahweh has spoken to you.
\q1

It is as though he is ready to bring darkness on you
\q2 and to cause you to stumble and fall as you walk on the hills when it is becoming dark.
\q1 So praise Yahweh your God before that happens.
\q1 If you do not do that, you will look for light,
\q2 but all you will see is darkness and gloom.
\q1

And if you still refuse to heed what he says,
\q2 what will happen to you because of your being proud will cause me to cry when I am alone.
\q1 My eyes will be filled with tears
\q2 because you, Yahweh's people,
\q2 whom he takes care of like a shepherd takes care of his flock,
\q2 will all be captured by your enemies and taken to other countries.
\q1

You people of Judah, say to the king and to his mother,
\q1 "Come down from sitting on your thrones
\q2 and humbly sit in the dirt,
\q2 because your enemies will soon snatch from your heads your glorious crowns."
\q1

The towns in the southern Judean wilderness will be surrounded by your enemies,
\q2 and no one will be able to get through their lines to rescue the people in those towns.
\q1 You people of Judah will be captured and taken away;
\q2 you will all be exiled.
\b
\q1

You leaders of Jerusalem, open your eyes and look:
\q1 the enemy armies are ready to march down from the north.
\q1 When that happens, what will happen to the people of Judah who are like a beautiful flock of sheep,
\q2 people that he gave to you to take care of?
\q1

What will you say when Yahweh appoints people from other countries to rule over you,
\q2 people who you mistakenly thought were your friends?
\q1 You will suffer very much pain,
\q2 like a woman who is about to give birth to a baby.
\q1

You will ask yourselves, "Why is this happening to us?"
\q2 I will reply that it is because of your many sins.
\q1 That is why soldiers of the invading armies will lift up the skirts of your women and rape them.
\q1

A man from Ethiopia certainly cannot change the color of his black skin,
\q2 and a leopard certainly cannot change its spots.
\q1 Similarly, you cannot start doing what is good,
\q2 because you have always done what is evil.
\b
\q1

Yahweh says, "I will scatter you like chaff
\q2 that is blown away by the wind from the desert.
\q1

That is what is certainly going to happen to you,
\q2 the things that I have determined will happen to you,
\q2 because you have forgotten me,
\q2 and you are trusting in false gods.
\q1

It is as though I myself will pull your skirts up over your faces
\q2 and cause you to be very ashamed because everyone will be able to see your private parts.
\q1

I have seen that you act like men who are eager to commit adultery;
\q2 you are like male horses that whinny when they desire to mate with a female horse.
\q1 I have seen that you worship disgusting idols in the fields and on the hills.
\q1 You people of Jerusalem, terrible things will happen to you because you will not be obedient and live a good life!
\q2 How long will it be until you are acceptable to me again?"

After there had been no rain in Judah for a long time, Yahweh gave Jeremiah this message:
\q1

The rich people send their servants to wells to get water,
\q2 but all the wells are dry.
\q1 The servants return with empty pitchers;
\q1 they cover their heads
\q2 because they are ashamed and humiliated.
\q1

The ground is extremely dry and cracked open
\q2 because there has been no rain.
\q1 The farmers are ashamed that they cannot raise a crop,
\q2 so they also cover their heads.
\q1

Even the does abandon their newborn babies,
\q2 because there is no grass in the fields for them to eat.
\q1

The wild donkeys stand on the barren hills,
\q2 panting like thirsty jackals.
\q1 They become blind
\q2 because there is no grass to eat.
\b
\q1

The people say, "Yahweh, if we have turned away from you and sinned many times,
\q2 we now know that we are being punished because of our sins!
\q1 Please help us
\q2 in order that everyone can see that you are very great and keep your promises.
\q1

You are the one whom we Israelites confidently expect to do good things for us
\q2 when we have many troubles.
\q1 So, why do you not help us?
\q2 You act as though you are a stranger in our land,
\q2 like you are someone who is staying here for only one night.
\q1

Are you also surprised about the terrible things that are happening to us?
\q2 Why do you act like you are unable to save anyone, even though you are a strong warrior?
\q1 Yahweh, you are here among us,
\q2 and others know that we are your people,
\q2 so do not abandon us!"

And this is what Yahweh says to those people:
\q1 "You love to wander away from me;
\q2 you run from one idol to another.
\q1 Therefore, now I will no longer accept you,
\q2 and I will punish you for your sins."
\b
Then Yahweh said to me, "Do not pray for these people anymore.

When they fast, I will not pay any attention. When they bring to me their offerings of animals to be completely burned on the altar and their offerings of flour, I will not accept them. Instead, I will get rid of them by wars, by famines, and by diseases."

Then I replied to him, "Yahweh my God, their prophets are telling the people that they will not experience wars or famines. They are telling the people that you will surely allow us to have peace in our land for many years."

Yahweh replied to me, "Those prophets say that they are speaking what I tell them to say, but they are telling lies. I did not send them, so what they are saying is false. They say that they have received visions from me, and that they are telling things that I have revealed to them, but that is not true. They are saying foolish things that they have only thought of themselves.

So this is what I say about those prophets who are predicting what will happen, saying that I told them those things: They are saying that we Israelites will not die from wars or famines, but I did not send those prophets. And they themselves will die from wars or from famines.

And the people to whom they are predicting these things, they and their wives and their sons and their daughters, will also die from wars or from famines. Their corpses will be thrown into the streets of Jerusalem, and there will not be anyone to bury them. I will punish them like they deserve to be punished.

So, Jeremiah, tell this to them about yourself:
\q1 'Day and night my eyes are full of tears.
\q2 I cannot stop crying.
\q1 I cry for my people,
\q2 who are very precious to me, as if they were my daughters.
\q2 I cry for them because they have been severely wounded;
\q2 and they will not recover or heal from this severe wound.
\q1

If I go out into the fields,
\q2 I see corpses of people who have been slaughtered by our enemies.
\q1 If I walk along the streets of the city,
\q2 I see corpses of people who died from hunger.
\q1 The prophets and the priests travel through the land, preaching to people,
\q2 but they do not know what they are doing .'"

Then I prayed this:
\q1 "Yahweh, have you completely rejected the people of Judah?
\q2 Do you really despise the people of Jerusalem?
\q1 Why have you wounded us very badly,
\q2 with the result that we will never be healed?
\q1 We hoped that we would have peace,
\q2 but there was no peace.
\q1 We hoped that there would be a time when we would be healed,
\q2 but all that we received were things that terrified us.
\q1

Yahweh, we admit that we are wicked people,
\q2 and that our ancestors also did many wicked things.
\q1 We have all sinned against you.
\q1

But Yahweh, in order that we may honor you,
\q2 do not despise us.
\q1 Do not dishonor the city where your glorious throne is.
\q1 Please do not forget us,
\q2 and do not break your agreement with us.
\q1

Those idols that have been brought from other nations certainly cannot bring rain to us,
\q2 and the sky certainly cannot cause rain to fall.
\q1 Yahweh our God, you are the only one who can do things like that.
\q2 So we will confidently expect you to help us."

Then Yahweh said this to me: "Even if Moses and Samuel could come back from their graves and and stand in front of me and plead with me for these Israelite people, I would not act mercifully toward these people. I would tell you to send them away from me. Cause them to leave me!

And if they ask you, 'Where shall we go?', tell them, 'This is what Yahweh says:
\q1 The ones that I say must die, will die:
\q1 The ones that I say must die in wars, will die in wars.
\q1 The ones that I say must die from hunger, will die from hunger.
\q1 The ones that I say must be captured and taken to other countries, will be captured and taken to other countries.

I will send four things that will get rid of them: I will send enemy soldiers using swords to kill them. I will send wild dogs to drag away their corpses. I will send vultures to eat their corpses. And I will send other wild animals to eat what remains of their corpses.

Because of the wicked things that King Manasseh did in Jerusalem, I will cause people in all the kingdoms of the earth to be horrified concerning what will happen in Judah to my people.
\q1

You people of Jerusalem, no one will feel sorry for you.
\q2 No one will weep for you.
\q2 No one will wish that you would not be hurt.
\q1

At the gates of your cities, I will scatter you like a farmer scatters the chaff from his grain by winnowing it.
\q2 You, my people, have refused to turn away from your evil behavior.
\q1 So, I will get rid of you,
\q2 and I will even cause your children to be killed.
\q1

I will cause there to be more widows in Judah
\q2 than there are grains of sand on the seashore.
\q1 I will bring on you an enemy army
\q2 that will destroy your young men and cause their mothers to weep.
\q1 I will cause you to suddenly experience great suffering and become very terrified.
\q1

A woman who has seven children will become faint and gasp for breath;
\q2 it will be as though her daylight will become darkness,
\q1 because most of her children will be dead,
\q2 and she will be disgraced and humiliated.
\q1 And her children who are still alive, I will enable your enemies to kill them.
\q2 That will surely happen because I, Yahweh, have said it.'"

But Yahweh replied to me,
\q1 "Jeremiah, I will take care of you.
\q1 And at times when you have the most troubles,
\q2 I will come on your behalf and protect you from your enemy.
\q1

But Judah's enemies, who are as strong as iron or bronze, will attack Judah from the north,
\q2 no one will be able to stop them.
\q1

I will give all the valuable possessions of your people to their enemies,
\q2 without them paying for it.
\q1 Your people will lose everything valuable
\q2 because of all the sins that they have committed throughout the country.
\q1

I will tell their enemies to force them to become their prisoners,
\q2 to take them to other lands that they have not experienced,
\q2 and force them to become their slaves.
\q1 That will happen because I am extremely angry with your people;
\q2 my anger is like a burning fire."
\q1

Then I said, "Yahweh, you know what is happening to me.
\q2 Please come and help me.
\q2 Punish those who are persecuting me.
\q1 Please do not continue to be patient with them
\q2 and do not allow me to die now.
\q1 It is for your sake that I am suffering.
\q1

Yahweh my God, you are the commander of the angel armies;
\q1 when you spoke to me,
\q2 I was delighted with your message; it caused me to be joyful,
\q1 and I eagerly accepted what you said
\q2 because I belong to you.
\q1

When the people were carousing together,
\q2 I never joined them;
\q1 I sat alone, because you are the one who controls what I do.
\q2 I was very angry with those people because of their sins.
\q1

So, why do you allow me to continue to suffer?
\q2 It seems that my wounds cannot be healed.
\q1 Sometimes you help me, sometimes you do not help me.
\q2 It seems that you are as undependable as a brook that has water in it only during certain seasons;
\q2 you are like a spring that has dried up."
\b

Then Yahweh replied to me saying this:
\q1 "If you begin again to trust in me,
\q1 I will restore you,
\q2 in order that you can continue to serve me.
\q1 If you proclaim good messages and not worthless ones,
\q2 you will continue to be the one who speaks what I tell you to say.
\q1 You must cause the people to pay attention to what you say;
\q2 you must not pay attention to what they say.
\q1

They will fight against you,
\q2 but I will protect you, like people are protected from their enemies by a bronze wall.
\q1 They will not defeat you,
\q2 because I will be with you,
\q2 and I will protect and rescue you.
\q1

Truly, I will keep you safe from those wicked people,
\q2 I will rescue you when you are seized by cruel people.
\q1 That will happen because I, Yahweh, have said it."
Yahweh gave me another message. He said to me,
"Do not get married and have children in this land,
because this is what I, Yahweh, say about the children who are born in this city, and about their mothers and fathers:

Many of them will die from terrible diseases. And no one will mourn for them. No one will even bury their corpses; the corpses will lie on the ground, scattered like manure. Others will die in wars or from hunger, and then their corpses will become food for vultures and wild animals."

This is also what Yahweh said to me: "Do not go to funerals to mourn or to show those whose relatives have died that you feel sorry for them, because I have stopped protecting them, and I have caused that things will not go well for them. I have stopped faithfully loving them and acting mercifully toward them.

Very many people will die in this land, including those who are important and those who are not important. And no one will mourn for them, or even bury their corpses. No one will cut himself or shave his head to show that he is very sad.
No one will bring food to comfort those who are mourning, not even if it is their father or their mother who is mourning. No one will give them a cup of wine to cheer them up.
And do not go into the houses where people are feasting. Do not eat or drink anything with them.

I want you to do this because this is what I, Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, say: 'While you are still alive and seeing it happen, I will cause there to be no more singing and laughing in this land. There will be no more joyful voices of bridegrooms and brides.'

When you tell these things to the people, they will ask, 'Why has Yahweh declared that these terrible things will happen to us? What have we done for which we deserve to be punished like this? What sin have we committed against Yahweh our God?'

Then this is what you must tell them that I am replying to them: 'It is because your ancestors turned away from me, Yahweh. They worshiped other gods and served them. They abandoned me and did not obey my commands.
But you who are living now have done more wicked things than your ancestors did! Each of you stubbornly does the evil things that he desires and refuses to pay attention to what I say.

So, I will throw you out of this land, and I will send you to a land that you and your ancestors have never known about. There you will worship other gods day and night. And I will not act mercifully toward you.'

But there will be a time when people who are solemnly promising to do something will no longer say, 'I will do this, just as surely as Yahweh lives—the one who brought the Israelite people here from Egypt.'

Instead, they will say 'I will do this, just as surely as Yahweh lives—the one who brought us Israelite people back to our own land, from the lands to the north and from all the other lands to which he had exiled us.' They will be able to say that because some day I will bring your descendants back to this land that I gave to your ancestors.

But now I am summoning your enemies who will seize them like fishermen catch fish. I am summoning those who will search for them on every mountain and hill, and in every cave, like hunters search for animals to kill.
I am watching them carefully. I see every sin that they commit. They will not be able to hide from me .

Because of all the wicked things that they have done , I will punish them twice as much as I would punish other people. I will do that because they have caused my own land to become unacceptable to me because of their worshiping lifeless statues of detestable gods, and also because they have filled my land with the other evil things that they have done."
\q1

No one can make their own gods;
\q2 the gods that they make are only idols; they are not real gods.'"
\b
\q1

Yahweh said, "It is as though a list of the sins committed by the people of Judah is engraved with an iron chisel, or engraved using the fine point of a very hard stone,
\q2 on their inner beings and on the altars where they worship their idols.
\q1

Even their children fondly remember when they went to the altars for their gods, and to the poles that represent the goddess Asherah at which their parents worshiped,
\q2 at the high places on the hills, where idols are worshiped, that are underneath all the big trees
\q2 and on all the high hills.
\q1

Their children remember these places on the hills. So I will allow your enemies to capture the mountain where you worship and the area around it,
\q2 and all your wealth and your treasures. It will be like the spoils of war for them
\q2 because of the sins that you people have committed throughout your land, and they will kill you.
\q1

The wonderful land that I gave to you will no longer belong to you.
\q1 I will tell your enemies to take you to a land that you do not know about,
\q2 and you will become their slaves.
\q1 I will do that because I am extremely angry with you;
\q2 my being angry is like a fire that will burn forever."

This is also what Yahweh says:
\q1 "Those who trust in human beings to help them are cursed,
\q2 those who rely on their own strength
\q2 and turn away from me with their inner beings.
\q1

They are like dry bushes in the desert,
\q2 they are people who will not experience any good things.
\q1 Those people will live in the barren desert
\q2 in a salty area, where no one can safely abide.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh is pleased with those who trust in him,
\q2 and who confidently expect him to take care of them.
\q1

Those people are like fruit trees that have been planted along a riverbank,
\q2 trees that have roots that go down into the wet ground beside the water.
\q1 They are trees whose leaves remain green when it becomes hot,
\q2 trees that continue to bear fruit when there are many months in which there is no rain.
\b
\q1

Human minds are extremely corrupt,
\q2 and we cannot change that.
\q2 It is also completely impossible for anyone to understand that.
\b
\q1

But I, Yahweh, search what is in everyone's inner being,
\q2 and I examine what they are thinking.
\q1 I will give all people reward or punishment,
\q2 what they deserve for what they have done."
\b
\q1

I know some people who become rich by doing things that are unjust.
\q2 They are like birds that hatch eggs that they did not lay.
\q1 So, when those people have lived only half of the years that they expect to live, they will disappear.
\q2 Then other people will realize that those people have been foolish.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, your temple is like a glorious throne
\q2 that has been on a high hill since it was built.
\q1

You are the one whom we Israelite people confidently expect to bless us,
\q2 and all those who turn away from you will be disgraced and feel what it is like to be separated from you,
\q2 because they have abandoned you, who are like a fountain where people obtain fresh water.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, please heal me, because if you heal me, I will truly be healed.
\q2 If you rescue me, I will truly be safe, because you are the only one whom I praise.
\q1

People often ridicule me and say,
\q1 "You tell us messages that you say came from Yahweh,
\q2 but why have the things that you predicted not happened?
\q1

Yahweh, you appointed me to take care of your people like a shepherd takes care of his sheep; I have not abandoned that work,
\q2 and you know that I have not previously wanted this time of disaster to come to people who ridicule me.
\q1 And you know everything that I have said to your people.
\q1

Do not cause me to be terrified!
\q2 When disasters come, you are the one to whom I will go to be safe.
\q1

So now, cause those who persecute me to be ashamed and dismayed,
\q2 but do not do things to me that will cause me to be ashamed and dismayed.
\q1 Cause them to be terrified!
\q2 Do to them many things that will completely destroy them!
This is what Yahweh said to me: "Go to the city gates in Jerusalem. First go to the gate where the kings of Judah go in and out of the city, and then go to each of the other gates.
Say to the people at each gate, 'You kings of Judah and everyone else who is living in Jerusalem and all you other people of Judah who enter these gates, listen to this message from Yahweh!
He says, "Listen to this warning carefully if you want to live! Stop doing work on Sabbath days! Stop carrying loads through these gates on those days!
Do not carry loads out of your houses or do any other work on Sabbath days! Instead, cause Sabbath days to be holy. I commanded your ancestors to do that,
but they did not listen to me or obey me. When I did things to correct them, they stubbornly refused to pay attention to what I said or to accept it.
But I say that if you obey me, and if you do not carry loads through these gates on Sabbath days or do any other work on Sabbath days, and if you dedicate the Sabbath days to me,

kings of Judah and their officials will continue to go in and out of these gates. There will always be someone who is a descendant of King David ruling here in Jerusalem. Kings and their officials will go in and out of these gates, riding in chariots and on horses, and there will be people living in this city forever.

And people will come to Jerusalem bringing offerings to be completely burned on the altar and other offerings. They will bring to the temple grain offerings and incense and offerings to thank me. People will bring these offerings from the towns in Judah and the villages near Jerusalem and from the land where the tribe of Benjamin lives and from the western foothills and from the southern Judean wilderness.

But if you do not pay attention to what I say, and if you refuse to dedicate the Sabbath days to me, and if you continue to carry loads through these gates into the city on Sabbath days, I will burn these gates completely. The fire will spread to the palaces, and no one will be able to put out that fire."'"
Yahweh gave another message to me. He said,
"Go to the shop of the man who makes clay pots. I will give you a message there."
So I went to that shop, and I saw the man who makes pots. He was working at the wheel that he uses to form pots.
But when he finished making one jar, it was not as good as he hoped it to be. So, he took the clay and formed it into another jar, shaping it as he desired to.
Then Yahweh gave me this message:

"Perhaps the people of Israel think that I cannot do to them like this man who makes pots has done. But what they think is wrong. I can control what happens to them like this man controls what he does with the clay in his hands.
There may be a time when I proclaim that I will get rid of a nation or kingdom, like someone pulls up a plant with its roots, and smash it, and destroy it.
But if the people of that nation repent of doing evil things, I will not send to them the disasters that I planned to send.
And there may be a time when I proclaim that I will establish a nation or kingdom and cause it to be strong.
But if the people of that nation start to do evil things and refuse to obey me, then I will not bless them as I said that I would do.

Therefore, Jeremiah, go and warn all the people in Jerusalem and in other places in Judah. Say to them, 'This is what Yahweh says: I am planning a disaster that I will send to you. So, each of you should turn from your evil behavior and start doing what is right, in order that good things will come to you instead!'
But the people will say back to you, 'It is useless for you to say these things to us. We will continue to be stubborn and behave as wickedly as we want to.'"

So this is what Yahweh said in response:
\q1 "Ask the people who live in other nations if they have ever heard of such a thing.
\q2 My Israelite people, who have been pure like virgins, have done a terrible thing!
\q1

The snow certainly never completely disappears from the rocky slopes of the mountains in Lebanon.
\q2 The cold streams that flow down from those distant mountains never cease flowing.
\q1

But my people are not as reliable as those streams:
\q2 They have abandoned me.
\q1 They burn incense to honor worthless idols.
\q1 It is as though they have stumbled as they walked along well known and reliable roads
\q2 and now, instead, they are walking on dirt paths.
\q1

Therefore, their land will become desolate,
\q2 and people who see it will hiss to ridicule it from now on.
\q1 All the people who pass by will be appalled;
\q2 they will shake their heads to show that they are shocked.
\q1

I will scatter the people when their enemies attack them
\q2 like dust is scattered by an east wind.
\q1 And when they experience all these disasters,
\q2 I will turn my back on them and refuse to help them."

Then the people said, "Come, we should plan to attack Jeremiah. We have many priests who teach us God's laws, wise men who give us good advice, and prophets who tell us what will happen. We do not need Jeremiah! So we should slander him and not pay attention to anything that he says."

Then I prayed, "Yahweh, please listen to me!
\q2 And listen to what my enemies are saying about me.
\q1

I am doing things that are good,
\q2 so it is disgusting that they are paying me back by doing evil things to me.
\q1 It is as though they have dug a pit for me to fall into and die.
\q2 Do not forget that one time I stood in front of you and pleaded for you to help them,
\q2 and I tried to prevent you from punishing them, even though you were very angry with them.
\q1

So now, allow their children to die from hunger!
\q2 Or cause them to be killed by their enemies' swords!
\q1 Cause their wives to become widows, whose children are all dead!
\q2 Cause their husbands to be killed in battles!
\q1

Cause people to scream in their homes
\q2 when enemy soldiers suddenly come into their houses!
\q1 Cause all these things to happen to them because they want to kill me.
\q1 It is as though they have dug a pit for me to fall into,
\q2 and they have hidden traps along my path.
\q1

Yahweh, you know all the things that they are planning to do to kill me.
\q1 Do not forgive them for their crimes
\q2 or blot out the record of their sins.
\q1 Cause them to be destroyed;
\q2 punish them because of your being angry with them!"
This is another message that Yahweh gave to me: "Go and buy a clay jar from a man who makes them. Then take with you some of the elders of the people and leaders of the priests.
Go out of the city past the Gate of Broken Pots, to the place overlooking the dump for broken pottery in the Hinnom Valley. Then give them a message.

Say to them, 'This message is for you kings of Judah and other people of Jerusalem. Listen to what Yahweh is saying! The God of Israel, Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, says that he will bring a terrible disaster on Jerusalem. Those who hear about it will be stunned.

That will happen because you Israelite people have stopped worshiping me, and have caused this place to be a place where you worship foreign gods. You burn sacrifices to gods that neither you nor your ancestors nor even the kings of Judah ever heard about. And you have filled this place with the blood of innocent people whom you have killed.

You have built houses on the top of many hills to honor your god Baal, and at those places you have killed your own children and offered them to be sacrifices to Baal. I never commanded you to do that, I never spoke about doing that, and never even considered allowing that!
So, beware, because I, Yahweh, say that there will be a time when this garbage dump will no longer be called Topheth or Hinnom Valley; it will be called Slaughter Valley.

In this place I will ruin the plans of you people who live in Jerusalem and in other places in Judah. I will allow your enemies who want to kill you to kill many of you with their swords. Then I will allow your corpses to remain on the ground to be food for vultures and wild animals.

I will completely destroy Jerusalem and cause it to become a heap of ruins that people will despise. All the people who pass by will be appalled, and they will be shocked when they see that the city has been destroyed.

I will enable your enemies who want to kill you to surround the city for a long time. Then the food will be all gone, and you people will be extremely hungry, with the result that you people in the city will eat the flesh of your own children and your neighbors' children.'
Jeremiah, after you tell that to them, while the people who are with you are watching, smash the jar that you brought.

Then say to them, 'This is what Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, says: Just like this jar has been smashed and cannot be repaired, I will smash this city of Jerusalem and other places in Judah. You will bury some of your corpses here in this dump, until there is no more space to bury any more corpses.
That is what I will do to this city and to you people who live here. I will make you unfit to worship me, and this city will be like you, just as Topheth is.

The houses in Jerusalem and the palaces of the kings of Judah will be unfit, like this place will be. All the houses where you burned incense on the rooftops to honor the stars that you worshiped, and where you poured out wine to be an offering to your gods, will become unfit for anyone who worships me to live in.'"
Then I returned from the garbage dump where Yahweh had sent me to tell them that message, and I stood in the courtyard of Yahweh's temple and said this to all the people who were there:

"This is what Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, says: 'I will bring a disaster to this city and to the villages around it like I promised, because you people have stubbornly refused to pay attention to what I said to you.'"
Pashhur son of Immer, was a priest who supervised the temple guards. He heard these things that I had prophesied.
So he arrested me. Then he commanded guards to whip me and fasten my feet in stocks at the Benjamin Gate of Yahweh's temple.
The next day, when Pashhur released me, I said to him, "Pashhur, Yahweh is giving you a new name. From now on, your name will be 'Surrounded by Terror,'

because Yahweh says this to you: 'I will cause you and your loved ones to be terrified. You will watch them being killed by your enemies' swords. I will enable the army of the king of Babylon to capture the people of Judah. Those soldiers will take some of the people to Babylon, and they will kill others with their swords.

And I will enable their soldiers to take away other things in Jerusalem: all your wealth and the produce of your hard work. They will take to Babylon all the very valuable things that belonged to your kings.
And as for you, Pashhur, they will take you and all your family to Babylon. You and your family and all your friends who have prophesied things that are lies will die there and be buried there.'"

One day I said this to Yahweh:
\q1 "Yahweh, when you chose me to be a prophet, you deceived me so that I would agree to do this work.
\q2 You forced me to become a prophet.
\q1 But now everyone ridicules me.
\q2 They make fun of me all the day.
\q1

When I tell people your messages, I shout saying,
\q2 'Yahweh is going to cause you to experience violence and destruction!'
\q1 So because I tell them those messages from you,
\q2 they insult me and scoff at me all the day.
\q1

But if I would say, 'I will never mention Yahweh or say anything about him, '
\q2 it would be as though your message would burn in my inner being like a fire;
\q2 it would be like a fire in my bones.
\q1 Sometimes I try to remain silent and not proclaim your messages,
\q2 but I am not able to do that.
\q1

I hear many people whispering about me,
\q2 saying 'He is the man who proclaims that there will be things that cause us to be terrified everywhere.
\q2 We must tell the authorities what he is saying! We must denounce him!'
\q1 Even my best friends are waiting for me to say something that is wrong.
\q1 They are saying, 'Perhaps we can cause him to say something wrong,
\q2 and if he does, we will be able to defeat him.'
\q1

But you, Yahweh, are helping me like a strong warrior,
\q2 so it is as though he will cause those who persecute me to stumble, and they will not defeat me.
\q1 They will be completely disgraced because of being unable to gain any advantage over me;
\q2 and other people will never forget that they were disgraced.
\q1

Yahweh, commander of the angel armies,
\q1 you examine all those who are righteous;
\q2 you know all that is in their inner beings and what they think.
\q1 Allow me to see you getting revenge on those who want to harm me,
\q2 because I came to you to petition for what is right."
\b
\q1

Sing to Yahweh!
\q2 Praise Yahweh!
\q1 He rescues poor and needy people,
\q2 from those who are wicked.
\b
\q1

But I hope that the day that I was born will be cursed.
\q2 I do not want anyone to celebrate that day when my mother gave birth to me.
\q1

And as for that man who brought to my father the news,
\q2 and caused him to be very happy, by saying
\q2 "Your wife has given birth to a son for you,"
\q1 I hope that he also will be cursed.
\q1

Allow him to be destroyed like the cities that Yahweh destroyed long ago,
\q2 without acting mercifully toward them.
\q1 Cause that man to hear the people wailing in the morning,
\q2 and to hear the enemy soldiers shout their battle cries at noon.
\q1

I want that to happen to him because he did not kill me when I was born.
\q2 I wish that I had died in my mother's womb,
\q2 and that my mother's body would have been like my grave.
\q1
Yahweh gave me another message when King Zedekiah of Judah sent a man named Pashhur son of Malkijah, and a priest named Zephaniah son of Maaseiah, to talk to me. They pleaded with me, saying,

"The army of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon is attacking Judah. Please speak to Yahweh for us. Ask him if he will help us. Perhaps he will force Nebuchadnezzar's army to leave by performing a miracle for us, like the miracles he performed previously."
I replied to them, "Go back to King Zedekiah. Tell him,

'This is what Yahweh, the God whom we Israelites worship, says: "I will cause your weapons to be useless in fighting against the king of Babylon and his army that is outside the walls of Jerusalem, attacking. I will enable them to enter into the center of this city.
I myself will fight against your army with my very great power, because I am very angry with you.
I will send a very terrible plague on the people of this city, and on their domestic animals, and many of them will die."

And Yahweh says there are many people in this city who want to kill you. So, he will enable the army of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and other people in this city to capture you, King Zedekiah, and your officials, and all the other people who do not die from the plague. His army will slaughter your soldiers; they will not act mercifully toward you or pity you at all.'
And tell this to all the people: 'Yahweh says that you must decide whether you want to die or to remain alive.

Everyone who remains in Jerusalem will die. They will be killed in battles or die from being hungry or from diseases. But those who surrender to the army of Babylon that is surrounding your city will remain alive. They will escape dying.

This will happen because I, Yahweh, have decided to cause this city to experience disasters, not to experience something good. The army of the king of Babylon will capture this city and will destroy it completely by fire.'"
Yahweh also told me to say this to the family of the king of Judah: "Listen to this message from Yahweh!

This is what he says to you descendants of King David:
\q1 'Every day, make fair decisions for the people whom you judge.
\q2 Help those who have been robbed.
\q2 Rescue them from robbers and abusers.
\q1 If you do not do that,
\q2 I will be angry and punish you with a fire that will be impossible to extinguish,
\q2 because of all the sins that you have committed.
\q1

I will fight against you people of Jerusalem,
\q2 you who live on top of a rocky hill above the valley.
\q1 I will fight against you people who boast, saying,
\q2 "No one can attack us and break through our defenses."
\q1
This is another message that Yahweh gave to me: "Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and say this to him:
'You are the king of Judah. You are the ruler, like King David was. You and your officials and your people must listen

to what Yahweh says: "Act fairly and justly. Do what is right. Help those who have been robbed. Rescue people from those who oppress them. Stop doing evil deeds. Do not mistreat those who have come here from other countries, and do not mistreat orphans and widows. Stop murdering here in Jerusalem.

If you obey these commands carefully, there will always be some descendant of King David who will be ruling here in Jerusalem. The king and his officials and other people will ride through the gates of the city in chariots and on horses.
But if you refuse to pay attention to these commands, I, Yahweh, solemnly declare, that this palace will become a pile of rubble."'"

And this is what Yahweh says about the king's palace:
\q1 "I like this palace, like I like the forests in the region of Gilead
\q2 and the mountains in Lebanon.
\q1 But I will cause this palace to become a desert,
\q2 a place that no one lives in.
\q1

I will select troops who will destroy this palace;
\q2 each soldier will use his own tools to wreck the building.
\q1 They will cut into pieces the beautiful big cedar beams
\q2 and throw them into a fire."
People from many nations will walk past the ruins of this city and say to each other, "Why did Yahweh destroy this city that was very great?"

And other people will reply, "He did it because his people stopped obeying the agreement that they had made with Yahweh their God. Instead, they worshiped other gods."
\b
\q1

Yahweh also says, "Do not mourn for King Josiah;
\q2 do not cry because he has died.
\q1 Instead, mourn for King Jehoahaz, his son,
\q2 because he will be captured and taken to another country,
\q1 and he will never return to see his own country, Judah, again."
\m
Jehoahaz became king after his father, King Josiah, died, but Jehoahaz was captured and taken to Babylonia. And this is what Yahweh says about him: "He also will never return to Judah.

He will die in that country where they have taken him as a captive and will never see his own country again."
\q1

He said, 'I will force my workers to build a huge beautiful palace
\q2 with very large rooms and many windows.
\q1 They will cover the walls with fragrant cedar panels
\q2 and paint them bright red.'"
\b
\q1

But it is certainly not having a beautiful cedar palace that causes a king to be great!
\q1 Jehoiakim's father, Josiah, also had plenty of things to eat and drink.
\q2 But Josiah always did things that are right and just,
\q2 and that is why God blessed him.
\q1

Josiah acted justly and helped poor and needy people,
\q2 so things went well for him.
\q1 Yahweh says, "That is the way a person should behave who knows me.
\q1

But Jehoiakim, you are greedy and desire only to obtain things by acting dishonestly.
\q2 You murder innocent people,
\q1 you oppress poor people,
\q2 and you treat people cruelly and violently."
\b

Therefore, this is what Yahweh says about Jehoiakim son of King Josiah:
\q1 "When he dies, people will not mourn for him.
\q2 They will not say to each other, 'It is very sad; we are so sorry!'
\q1 The people whom he ruled will not mourn for him, saying,
\q2 'We are sad that our king is dead; we are so sorry that the wonderful things that happened while he was king are ended.'
\q1

When he dies, people will do to his corpse what they do to a dead donkey;
\q2 his corpse will be dragged out of Jerusalem and dumped outside the gates!
\b
\q1

You people of Judah, go to the mountains in Lebanon and weep,
\q2 shout in the mountains of the Bashan region,
\q1 call out in mourning in the mountains of Moab,
\q2 because all your friends in those areas have been destroyed.
\q1

When you were prosperous, I warned you,
\q2 but you replied, 'We will not pay attention to what you say.'
\q1 You have been acting like that since you were young;
\q2 you have never obeyed me.
\q1

So, now I will punish all your leaders;
\q2 it will be as though they have been blown away by the wind.
\q1 They will be captured by your enemies and taken to another country.
\q1 When that happens, you will truly be ashamed and disgraced
\q2 because of all the wicked things that you have done.
\q1

Now, your king enjoys living in the cedar rooms in his palace,
\q2 but soon he will be punished,
\q1 and then he will groan
\q2 like a woman who is giving birth to a baby."
Yahweh says this: "Jehoiachin son of King Jehoiakim of Judah, as surely as I am alive, I will punish you. Even if you were the ring on my finger that shows that I am the king, I would pull you off.
You are afraid of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and his huge army, because they are wanting to kill you. I will enable them to capture you.
I will expel you and your mother from this land, and you will be taken to another country. Neither of you were born there, but you will both die there.

You will never return to this land that you will very much desire to return to."
\q1

Someone said, "Jehoiachin will be like a broken pot
